label: ABC3_hR10_161_a_a_b-001
title: Ferroelectric LiNbO$_{3}$ Structure
comments:
This is the ferroelectric phase of LiNbO$_{3}$, which is stable below 1430K. There is also a \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_hR10_167_a_b_e-001}{high-temperature paraelectric phase}. 
 In the special case $c/a = \sqrt{6}, z_{1} = 1/4, z_{2} = 0, x_{3} = 1/2, y_{3} = 0, z_{3} = 0$ this reduces to a double unit cell version of the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_cP5_221_a_c_b-001}{cubic perovskite ($E2_{1}$) structure}. This sets the angle between the rhombohedral primitive vectors to 60$^{\circ}$. Experimentally the value is about 56$^{\circ}$.
